comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Woo hoo! This photo was published in the Sydney Morning Herald, 29/10/1928, p.14 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16504967
25,000 PEOPLE INSPECT H.M.A.S. AUSTRALIA. During all yesterday afternoon continuous crowds inspected the Australia. So great was the congestion that the police had to control the traffic.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05]  Oops! Silly me - you already knew that!  
[promises to read blurb in future!]

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm unimpressed that not one of the 25,000 visitors had the foresight to leave behind some indelible mark so that 80 plus years down the track we'd be able to conclusively distinguish HMAS Australia II from her sister ship HMAS Canberra I. What were these sightseers up to!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Just saw this, and the [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/] pic, love how our collections overlap :) QM, oh the frustrations of historical investigations :P
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
